meanings.definition: A person who regularly frequents a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The habitue of the library always sits in the same corner.
meanings.sent2: The habitue of the cafe orders the same coffee every morning.
meanings.sent3: The habitue of the park brought a picnic basket today.
meanings.sent4: She was a habitue of the theater, always enchanted by the performances.
meanings.sent5: The habitue of the gym could be seen lifting weights every evening.

meanings.definition: A person who is a regular customer or client.
meanings.sent1: The habitue of the bakery buys fresh bread daily.
meanings.sent2: As a habitue of the salon, she always gets her hair styled there.
meanings.sent3: The habitue of the ice cream shop tried every flavor on the menu.
meanings.sent4: He was a habitue of the bookstore, devouring novels every week.
meanings.sent5: The habitue of the market knew all the vendors by name.

meanings.definition: A person who is accustomed to a particular activity or way of life.
meanings.sent1: Growing up in the countryside, she became a habitue of nature.
meanings.sent2: The habitue of early morning runs enjoyed the peaceful start to the day.
meanings.sent3: The habitue of yoga class could twist into any pose effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: He was a habitue of meditation, finding calm in the chaos of life.
meanings.sent5: The habitue of painting found solace in every brushstroke.
